original: @237a # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @237a # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa ta th'a ga ta sta ba:/
analyzed: panytsa ta th'a ga ta sta ba:/
translated: Pañcatathāgatastava

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bstod pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la bstod pa //
translated: Praise to the Five Tathagatas

original: gsung gi mnga' bdag la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsung gi mnga' bdag la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Speech!

original: 'jig rten gsum mgon yon tan mtha' med pha rol phyin //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum mgon yon tan mtha' med pha rol phyin //
translated: Protector of the three worlds, perfected in infinite qualities,

original: 'o ma'i mtsho ltar dkar yangs mdzes pa'i sku dang ldan //
analyzed: 'o ma'i mtsho ltar dkar yangs mdzes pa'i sku dang ldan //
translated: Possessing a body as fair and lovely as a sea of milk,

original: mnyam med de bzhin nyid dngos seng ge'i khri la bzhugs //
analyzed: mnyam med de bzhin nyid dngos seng ge'i khri la bzhugs //
translated: Unequalled, the very essence of suchness, seated on a lion throne,

original: thub mchog rnam par snang ba de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thub mchog rnam par snang ba de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme sage, Vairocana.

original: mdangs ldan nor bu mthon ka chen po ltar 'phro ba'i //
analyzed: mdangs ldan nor bu mthon ka chen po ltar 'phro ba'i //
translated: Radiating light like a great sapphire,

original: 'od kyis phyogs rnams ma lus snang bar mdzad pa po //
analyzed: 'od kyis phyogs rnams ma lus snang bar mdzad pa po //
translated: Illuminating all directions without exception,

original: 'jig rten gsum na rmad byung glang po'i khri la bzhugs //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na rmad byung glang po'i khri la bzhugs //
translated: Seated on a wondrous elephant throne in the three worlds,

original: bsnyengs bral sangs rgyas mi bskyod de la rtag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: bsnyengs bral sangs rgyas mi bskyod de la rtag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I constantly pay homage to that fearless Buddha Akshobhya.

original: rin chen dbang bskur 'byor bas 'gro don mdzad la mkhas //
analyzed: rin chen dbang bskur 'byor bas 'gro don mdzad la mkhas //
translated: Skilled in bestowing consecration with jewels and benefiting beings through wealth,

original: @237b bsod nams tshogs mnga' ri rgyal mngon sum rgyu 'dra zhing //
analyzed: @237b bsod nams tshogs mnga' ri rgyal mngon sum rgyu 'dra zhing //
translated: You are the king of mountains, the source of the accumulation of merit,

original: gser gyi rgya mtsho lta bus rta yi gdan la bzhugs //
analyzed: gser gyi rgya mtsho lta bus rta yi gdan la bzhugs //
translated: Seated on a horse, like an ocean of gold.

original: thub pa rin chen 'byung ldan de la rtag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: thub pa rin chen 'byung ldan de la rtag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I constantly pay homage to you, the Sage Ratnasambhava.

original: rma bya'i rigs gsal brgya yis mdzes byas snang ba yi //
analyzed: rma bya'i rigs gsal brgya yis mdzes byas snang ba yi //
translated: The light of a hundred clear peacocks beautifies the appearance,

original: 'od kyis phyogs kun khebs pas mngon dga' pad+ma ni //
analyzed: 'od kyis phyogs kun khebs pas mngon dga' pad+ma ni //
translated: The light covers all directions, and the lotus is delightful.

original: r'a ga'i ri bo ltar mdzes rma bya'i gdan bzhugs pa //
analyzed: r'a ga'i ri bo ltar mdzes rma bya'i gdan bzhugs pa //
translated: Seated on a peacock throne, beautiful like a mountain of red dye,

original: thub pa dpag med 'od mnga' de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thub pa dpag med 'od mnga' de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, the Sage Amitābha.

original: dam chos 'od zer tshogs kyis mun pa sel mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: dam chos 'od zer tshogs kyis mun pa sel mdzad pa'i //
translated: The assembly of light rays of the sublime Dharma clears away darkness,

original: 'od kyi snang bas nam mkha'i cha kun rnam par 'gengs //
analyzed: 'od kyi snang bas nam mkha'i cha kun rnam par 'gengs //
translated: The light fills all parts of the sky with illumination,

original: bee d'urya yi mtsho ltar mkha' lding gdan la bzhugs //
analyzed: bee d'urya yi mtsho ltar mkha' lding gdan la bzhugs //
translated: Seated on a garuḍ throne, like an ocean of beryl,

original: sangs rgyas don yod grub pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas don yod grub pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, the Buddha Amoghasiddhi.

original: seng ge glang po rta dang rma bya mkha' lding gdan la rdo rje skyil krung bzhugs //
analyzed: seng ge glang po rta dang rma bya mkha' lding gdan la rdo rje skyil krung bzhugs //
translated: Seated in vajra posture on lion, elephant, horse, peacock, and garuḍ thrones,

original: sku mdog rim bzhin dkar dang sngo dang ser dang dri med dmar dang ljang gyur cing //
analyzed: sku mdog rim bzhin dkar dang sngo dang ser dang dri med dmar dang ljang gyur cing //
translated: Their colors are white, blue, yellow, stainless red, and green, respectively.

original: byang chub mchog dang sa reg mchog sbyin ting 'dzin mi 'jigs sbyin pa'i phyag rgyas mtshan //
analyzed: byang chub mchog dang sa reg mchog sbyin ting 'dzin mi 'jigs sbyin pa'i phyag rgyas mtshan //
translated: They are marked with the mudras of supreme enlightenment, the earth-touching gesture, generosity, concentration, and fearlessness.

original: rang rigs rin chen cod pan ldan pa'i ye shes lnga yi bdag nyid de la 'dud //
analyzed: rang rigs rin chen cod pan ldan pa'i ye shes lnga yi bdag nyid de la 'dud //
translated: I bow to them, the embodiments of the five wisdoms, with jeweled crowns of their respective families.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bstod pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bstod pa rdzogs so /
translated: The praise of the five tathagatas is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pad+ma ka ra warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pad+ma ka ra warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian abbot Padmākaravarman and the great editor and translator-monk Rinchen Zangpo.
